content.question: Which of the following features best explains why the United Kingdom has what Sartori calls a “centrifugal” party system?

choices.label: There is one dominant political party in the United Kingdom.
The United Kingdom is a unitary system with devolved regional powers.
Members of Parliament are chosen through proportional representation.
Single-member districts promote two centrist political parties.

content.answer: Single-member districts promote two centrist political parties.

unit.text: 4: Party and Electoral Systems and Citizen Organizations

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how the author's argument or perspective relates to political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
